source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves 4–11 cm long; leaflets mostly 5–15 mm wide; calyx 12–20 mm long, teeth acuminate, equal to or longer than calyx tube; corolla 17–30 mm long; pod yellow-brown or dark brown, torulose or not; seeds 3–7 mm long
Leaves 2.5–7 cm long; leaflets mostly 4–10 mm wide; calyx 7–12 mm long, teeth subulate, shorter than calyx tube; corolla 8–20 mm long; pod very dark brown to black, not torulose; seeds 2.4–4 mm long
Pod 4–6 mm wide, not torulose, dark brown; seeds 3–5 mm long
Pod 6–12 mm wide, torulose, yellow-brown; seeds 4.5–6.5 mm long
